title: Man on the Run: No decision yet regarding Najib's request, says Fahmi
summary: The government has not made any decision regarding the request by former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak to instruct the streaming application service Netflix to take down and prohibit the screening of the documentary Man on the Run.
content:
PETALING JAYA (Jan 13): The government has not made any decision regarding the request by former prime minister Datuk Seri Najib Razak to instruct the streaming application service Netflix to take down and prohibit the screening of the documentary Man on the Run.

Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil said this was because it involved an ongoing court case.

"Some initial views have been conveyed by the Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (M

title: Six involved in RM33 mil luxury car duty evasion to be charged next Monday — report
summary: Six members of a syndicate alleged to have cheated the government of over RM33 million in luxury car duties will be charged at the Alor Setar Sessions Court in Kedah next Monday and Tuesday (Jan 15 and 16), according to a report on Utusan Malaysia’s website on Saturday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 13): Six members of a syndicate alleged to have cheated the government of over RM33 million in luxury car duties will be charged at the Alor Setar Sessions Court in Kedah next Monday and Tuesday (Jan 15 and 16), according to a report on Utusan Malaysia’s website on Saturday.

All suspects, who are operators and 'runners' of a seized luxury car storage warehouse service in Pulau Langkawi, were previously detained through a special operation conducted by the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Co

title: KL-Singapore HSR project not affected by Japanese firms' withdrawal, says Loke
summary: The Kuala Lumpur-Singapore high-speed rail (HSR) project remains unaffected even though Japanese firms have withdrawn from involvement in the construction of the project, said Transport Minister Anthony Loke.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 13): The Kuala Lumpur-Singapore high-speed rail (HSR) project remains unaffected even though Japanese firms have withdrawn from involvement in the construction of the project, said Transport Minister Anthony Loke.

He said that Japanese companies are free to decide whether to participate in the project or not, as it is still in the request for information (RFI) stage.

"If Japanese companies are not interested in entering the tender, it is up to

title: Zahid proposes bill to maintain a govt until end of its term
summary: Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi has proposed the introduction of a bill in Parliament aimed at maintaining a particular government until the end of its term.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 13): Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi has proposed the introduction of a bill in Parliament aimed at maintaining a particular government until the end of its term.

The Umno president emphasised that this would prevent the recurrence of instances like when the prime minister was changed three times during the 14th parliament term.

"The nation faced adverse effects, particularly during economic challenges and the Covid-19 pa

title: Bursa expected to trade on cautious note next week
summary: Bursa Malaysia is expected to trade on a cautious note next week given the major change in the macro situation following the higher-than-expected US inflation print, which would push back the interest rate cut expectation.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 13): Bursa Malaysia is expected to trade on a cautious note next week given the major change in the macro situation following the higher-than-expected US inflation print, which would push back the interest rate cut expectation.

Rakuten Trade equity research vice-president Thong Pak Leng expects the benchmark FTSE Bursa Malaysia KLCI (FBM KLCI) to stay in consolidation mode next week until more clarity surfaces.

"Our market under-performed last

title: CPO futures likely to trade with upward bias next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade with an upward bias next week given expectations of a weaker output due to seasonal factors, said palm oil trader David Ng.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The crude palm oil (CPO) futures contract on Bursa Malaysia Derivatives is expected to trade with an upward bias next week given expectations of a weaker output due to seasonal factors, said palm oil trader David Ng.

He said the continued strength in external markets for soybean oil and crude oil is expected to boost market sentiment in the near term.

"We expect CPO futures to trade with an upward bias with prices looking to test the RM3,950 level. Suppor

title: Ringgit expected to see cautious trading next week
summary: The ringgit is expected to continue trading cautiously next week, as investors await a slew of economic data scheduled to be released by several major economies.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 13): The ringgit is expected to continue trading cautiously next week, as investors await a slew of economic data scheduled to be released by several major economies.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said next week, the focus would be on China’s fourth-quarter 2023 gross domestic product numbers which will be released on Wednesday, along with the UK and European Union’s consumer price index (CPI).

“Given

title: Capital gains tax: More than expected
summary: Beginning Jan 1, the capital gains tax (CGT) took effect. Many were under the impression that it would be limited to gains or profits from the disposal of unlisted shares in Malaysia based on the Budget 2024 announcement.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 13): Beginning Jan 1, the capital gains tax (CGT) took effect. Many were under the impression that it would be limited to gains or profits from the disposal of unlisted shares in Malaysia based on the Budget 2024 announcement.  

However, when the draft Finance (No 2) Bill 2023 was tabled in November last year, it turned out to be much more than just taxing gains from the disposal of unlisted shares. The CGT taxes, among others, gains from indirect transfers and from disposal of foreign c

title: Oil climbs 1% as tankers avoid Red Sea
summary: Oil rose 1% on Friday as an increasing number of oil tankers diverted course from the Red Sea following overnight air and sea strikes by the US and Britain on Houthi targets in Yemen after attacks on shipping by the Iran-backed group.
content:
Brent crude futures settled 88 cents, or 1.1%, higher at US$78.29 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude futures climbed 66 cents, or 0.9%, to US$72.68.

HOUSTON: Oil rose 1% on Friday as an increasing number of oil tankers diverted course from the Red Sea following overnight air and sea strikes by the US and Britain on Houthi targets in Yemen after attacks on shipping by the Iran-backed group.

Brent c

title: US stocks end flat as earnings offset inflation data
summary: US stocks closed barely changed on Friday, after wavering between modest gains and losses, as mixed bank earnings offset cooler-than-expected inflation news that buoyed hopes for interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve.
content:
The Dow fell 118.04 points, or 0.31%, to 37,592.98. The S&P 500 gained 3.59 points, or 0.08 %, at 4,783.83 and the Nasdaq rose 2.58 points, or 0.02%, to 14,972.76.

NEW YORK: US stocks closed barely changed on Friday, after wavering between modest gains and losses, as mixed bank earnings offset cooler-than-expected inflation news that buoyed hopes for interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve.

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Red Sea tensions put focus on US energy stocks
summary: A recent rally that has boosted nearly every corner of the US stock market has left energy shares behind, and bullish investors are betting upcoming earnings reports and rising geopolitical tensions could spark a rebound for the struggling group.
content:
The energy sector has slumped nearly 3% since late October, a period during which the S&P 500 has surged 16%. — Reuters

NEW YORK: A recent rally that has boosted nearly every corner of the US stock market has left energy shares behind, and bullish investors are betting upcoming earnings reports and rising geopolitical tensions could spark a rebound for the struggling group.

title: Penang water cut: Govt considering giving grants or loans — Fadillah
summary: The government is studying the need to extend aid in the form of grants or loans to Penang for main valves upgrading works at the Sungai Dua Water Treatment Plant (LRA) in Butterworth, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof.
content:
KUCHING (Jan 12): The government is studying the need to extend aid in the form of grants or loans to Penang for main valves upgrading works at the Sungai Dua Water Treatment Plant (LRA) in Butterworth, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Fadillah Yusof.

Fadillah, who is also Energy Transition and Public Utilities Minister, said valve replacement works involving maintenance operations in the state need to be implemented to prevent further losses due to non-revenue water (NRW).

title: Israel-Palestine: PM urges Germany to use influence to press for ceasefire
summary: Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Friday urged Germany to use its influence to press for a ceasefire in the Israel-Palestine conflict and to allow humanitarian access.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 12): Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim on Friday urged Germany to use its influence to press for a ceasefire in the Israel-Palestine conflict and to allow humanitarian access.

He conveyed this stance to German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock during her courtesy call on him at Perdana Putra in Putrajaya.

“The main focus of the discussion was on Palestine, where I firmly reiterated Malaysia’s stance for the West to stop their pretense re

title: Unfair but reasonable is common
summary: AT the end of the last trading day last year, little-known Kuchai Development Bhd (KDB) agreed to dispose of its entire asset and liabilities to its sister company, Sungei Bagan Rubber Co (M) Bhd (SBR) for RM275.5mil via the issuance of 27.5 million new SBR shares priced at RM10.01 each.
content:
Overall, when one looks at a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets, while it may be fair on paper, it may not be fair when looking at market prices of the listed securities, or vice-versa.

AT the end of the last trading day last year, little-known Kuchai Development Bhd

title: All systems go for tourism rebound in the country
summary: A resurgence in the tourism industry is set to lift several sectors along with broad-based gains.
content:
“I expect Malaysia’s gross value-added tourism sector to be about RM280bil in 2024," former investment banker Yoong said.

A resurgence in the tourism industry is set to lift several sectors along with broad-based gains.

The government expects tourist arrivals in Malaysia this year to see a strong recovery, with early indications suggesting the number could even surpass the pre-pandemic levels.

title: UMW Toyota registers strong sales in 2023
summary: UMW Toyota Motor Sdn Bhd (UMWT) reported total sales of 10,402 units in December, bringing its total year-to-date sales to 108,107 units.
content:
Year-on-year sales rose by 7%, UMW Toyota Motor said.

PETALING JAYA: UMW Toyota Motor Sdn Bhd (UMWT) reported total sales of 10,402 units in December, bringing its total year-to-date sales to 108,107 units.

In a statement, the company said it sold 10,079 Toyota vehicles in the month along with 323 Lexus cars.

title: Look at the broader market for opportunities
summary: Increased investor interest on Bursa Malaysia led the FBM KLCI to hit a year high of 1,503 points on Tuesday, leading many to hope 2024 will be the year the local market pivots higher ahead of the Chinese Lunar Year of the Dragon next month.
content:
Upbeat sentiment: The positive fundamentals of the Malaysian economy has led many analysts and fund managers to have a constructive view of the local market backed by the anticipation of sustained GDP growth of above 4%. — AFP

title: Venture debt to fill gap in Indonesia
summary: With venture capital (VC) tightening its purse strings and fundraising expected to be tougher this year, venture debt, as an alternative source of funding, could be the star of the show in Indonesia’s prolonged tech winter, say industry insiders.
content:
OCBC Ventura's Darryl says “venture debt is not for everyone.” — The Jakarta Post

WITH venture capital (VC) tightening its purse strings and fundraising expected to be tougher this year, venture debt, as an alternative source of funding, could be the star of the show in Indonesia’s prolonged tech winter, say industry insiders.

title: Siab, Tuju Setia, Masteel, MST Golf, Careplus, YNH Property, HE Group, Ranhill Utilities, Magna Prima, CMSB and Bintai Kinden
summary:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 12): Here is a brief recap of some corporate announcements that made the news on Friday:

Building construction services provider Siab Holdings Bhd has secured a contract to build a food processing factory in Seremban, Negeri Sembilan, worth RM94.28 mil...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Jan 12): Here is a brief recap of some corporate announcements that made the news on Friday:

Building construction services provider Siab Holdings Bhd has secured a contract to build a food processing factory in Seremban, Negeri Sembilan, worth RM94.28 million.
